data.title: CosMOPED: Compressed Planck likelihood
data.name: cosmoped
data.description: Compressed CMB likelihood code that uses the MOPED (Multiple/Massively Optimised Parameter Estimation and Data compression) compression scheme to compress the Planck power spectrum

evidence: "To compute the likelihood for the LambdaCDM model using CosMOPED you only need 6 compression vectors... Using these, the likelihood of a theory power spectrum given the *Planck* data is just the product of 6 one-dimensional Gaussians."
"For a quick start example see cosmoped_likelihood_example.py" and usage via `python compression_vectors.py` and importing `CosMOPED` indicate it is run directly as analysis code.
Owner metadata: owner_type: User; owner_login: heatherprince, with no mention of an institution or group in the README, suggesting an individual maintainer.
